Package xyz.rk0cc.willpub.pubspec.data.dependencies.type

Class LocalReference

java.lang.Object
xyz.rk0cc.willpub.pubspec.data.dependencies.type.DependencyReference
xyz.rk0cc.willpub.pubspec.data.dependencies.type.LocalReference
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public final class LocalReference extends DependencyReference
Getting dependency in local drive only.

WARNING

The provided path() is according to the working device's storage space only which it possibility absent on other device.
Since:
1.0.0

    • LocalReference

      public LocalReference(@Nonnull String name, @Nonnull Path path) throws IllegalPubPackageNamingException
      Create new LocalReference dependency info.
      Parameters:
      name - Package name.
      path - Path to the package (in local device).
      Throws:
      IllegalPubPackageNamingException - When the package name is illegal.

      Returns:
      Path to the dependency.

    • changePath

      @Nonnull public LocalReference changePath(@Nonnull Path path)
      Change the location to related path.
      Parameters:
      path - New Path of package location.
      Returns:
      A LocalReference with new path applied.

    • changePath

      @Nonnull public LocalReference changePath(@Nonnull String path, String... subpath)
      Change the location to related path.
      Parameters:
      path - Path to the package location or first path location.
      subpath - If path is not a completed path, it will be used to join as a complete path.
      Returns:
      A LocalReference with new path applied.

    • toFile

      @Nonnull public File toFile(@Nonnull Path projectPath) throws NotDirectoryException
      Resolve an actual File object of referencing dependency's directory.
      Parameters:
      projectPath - An absolute path of the project directory.
      Returns:
      A File which is a directory of dependency project.
      Throws:
      NotDirectoryException - If File.isDirectory() return false which means the applied path is not a directory.
      See Also:
      • PubspecManager.resolvePathOfLocalReference(LocalReference)

    • hashCode

      public int hashCode()
      Hash code of DependencyReference which generated by Objects.hash(Object...).
      It's usually hashes all unique object given from subclasses and add DependencyReference.hashCode() which is a hashes DependencyReference.name().
